entries.title: Tempers Flaring Over Onions Show Marcos Faces Risk on Prices
entries.description: Ferdinand Marcos Jr made a curious move when he became Philippine president-elect in mid-2022: he named himself agriculture minister, pledging to fix the country’s food problems.

entries.title: Trump Drops Deutsche Bank Subpoena Fight With New GOP-Led House
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump has ended his long-running legal fight with two congressional committees over access to his financial records now that Republicans have a House majority.

entries.title: TikTok General Counsel No Longer Oversees US Relations
entries.description: ByteDance Ltd.’s general counsel is no longer overseeing US government relations for TikTok, part of a shuffle to improve the company’s standing during intense national security scrutiny, according to people familiar with the matter.

entries.title: Musk Breezes Through Washington as Smooth CEO, Not Twitter Troll
entries.description: On Twitter, Elon Musk is a right-leaning, irreverent firebrand. In Washington, he’s a smooth political operator who knows his way around power.

entries.title: Chicago Mayor Touts Credit Market ‘Validation’ Ahead of Election
entries.description: Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot is highlighting her administration’s record of credit rating upgrades, higher pension contributions and other financial strides made over the last four years as she seeks a second term next month.

entries.title: Cuomo Defense in Discrimination Suit to Be Paid by NY Taxpayers
entries.description: New York taxpayers must foot the bill for former Governor Andrew Cuomo’s legal defense in a civil suit filed by a onetime member of his security detail who accused him of sexual harassment, a judge ruled.

entries.title: Federal Election Commission Asks Santos Campaign, ‘Who’s the Boss?’
entries.description: The Federal Election Commission is asking a man who says he’s not responsible for handling Representative George Santos’s campaign funds why the agency has received paperwork saying otherwise.

entries.title: McDaniel Beats Back Strong Challenge to Retain Republican National Committee Chair
entries.description: Ronna McDaniel won a fourth term as Republican National Committee chair Friday, a status quo choice by party faithful even after a series of stinging election defeats with Donald Trump as GOP standard-bearer.

entries.title: Sunak Offered Hope for Next Election — If His Government Can Get Its Act Together
entries.description: Australian pollster tells Tory cabinet that voters don’t feel strong attraction to Labour and election is winnable if they can address the country’s problems

entries.title: Elon Musk Faces SEC Probe for Role in Tesla Self-Driving Claims
entries.description: US regulators are investigating Elon Musk’s role in shaping Tesla Inc.’s self-driving car claims, the latest effort by watchdogs to scrutinize the actions of the world’s second-richest person.

entries.title: Republican Senators Warn Biden They Won’t Back ‘Clean’ Debt-Limit Hike
entries.description: A group of two dozen Republican senators warned President Joe Biden that they won’t support a debt ceiling increase without “structural” changes to US spending, a shot across the bow as the parties stake out their positions.

entries.title: Seven Israelis Killed in Gun Attack at Jerusalem Synagogue
entries.description: A gunman shot to death seven Israelis in an attack on a synagogue in a Jewish neighborhood of East Jerusalem as tensions soared following the Thursday killing of nine Palestinians in a clash with Israeli security officials in the West Bank.

entries.title: UK and EU Nearing Provisional Brexit Deal in Northern Ireland Talks
entries.description: UK and European Union negotiators are nearing a provisional agreement on post-Brexit arrangements for Northern Ireland, putting them in touching distance of a final settlement after years of often fraught talks, people familiar with the matter said.

entries.title: G-7 Floats Higher Price Cap on Russian Diesel as EU Mulls Level
entries.description: The Group of Seven has signaled that it’s comfortable with the European Union setting a price cap for exports of Russian diesel between $100 and $110 per barrel as the US and its allies try to avoid a major disruption in the market, according to a G-7 official.

entries.title: Lula, Governors Discuss Fixes for Abrupt Drop in Tax Revenue
entries.description: Brazil’s President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and governors are discussing a solution for an abrupt decline in state governments’ revenue, following a series of tax breaks spearheaded by the previous administration to ease inflation pressures.

entries.title: Biden Wins Deal With Netherlands, Japan on China Chip Export Limit
entries.description: President Joe Biden’s administration secured an agreement with the Netherlands and Japan to restrict exports of some advanced chipmaking machinery to China in talks that concluded Friday in Washington, according to people familiar with the matter.

entries.title: Musk Met Biden Officials to Discuss EV Production
entries.description: Tesla Inc. CEO Elon Musk met with Biden administration officials to discuss ways to advance electric vehicle production, according to the White House.

entries.title: House Republicans Pivot Away From Big Tech Antitrust Crackdown
entries.description: The new GOP House majority is turning away from last year’s bipartisan efforts to rein in the dominance of the largest tech companies with a change in leadership on a key panel.

entries.title: NHS Set to Announce Plan to Reduce UK Emergency Waits
entries.description: Britain’s under-pressure National Health Service will publish a plan on Monday setting out how it will cut ambulance and accident and emergency waiting times this year, people familiar with the plans said.

entries.title: Peru’s Violent Protests Imperil 30% of Its Copper Output
entries.description: An upsurge in the violent protests wracking Peru is crimping copper output in the world’s No. 2 supplier, with about 30% of its production at risk at a time of low global stocks and high prices.

entries.title: Hunt Tells Sunak UK Inflation May Not Fall as Quickly as Hoped
entries.description: Jeremy Hunt, UK chancellor of the exchequer, during a Bloomberg Television interview in London, UK, on Friday, Jan. 27, 2023. Hunt dismissed calls for tax cuts, warning that “sound money must come first” as he argued that Brexit will drive economic growth.

entries.title: McCarthy Critic Gets Plum House Judiciary Surveillance Gavel
entries.description: Republican Andy Biggs, who unsuccessfully challenged Kevin McCarthy in the House speaker race, will lead the Judiciary subcommittee on crime and federal government surveillance.

entries.title: Janet Yellen Sees Recession Risk Even With Improving Inflation, Jobs
entries.description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said she’s encouraged by recent US data on inflation and jobs but conceded the economy is at risk of recession amid high interest rates.

entries.title: House Passes Bill Tying Oil Reserve Releases to Federal Output
entries.description: Legislation that would tie the release of oil from US emergency stockpiles to more federal oil and gas production was passed by the House, as Republicans use their majority to highlight the Biden administration’s historic drawdown from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve.

entries.title: FBI Double-Agent Debacle Shows Agency Polices Itself, Wray Says
entries.description: The investigation and arrest of a retired Federal Bureau of Investigation official for allegedly laundering money and violating US sanctions against Russia shows the agency can police itself, FBI Director Christopher Wray said.

entries.title: Yellen Says Raising Debt Limit Is Only Solution to Avoid Fiscal Crisis
entries.description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the only solution to avoid a US default crisis is for Congress to increase the federal debt limit, avoiding engaging with other proposed stopgap measures including short-term extensions or spending cuts.

entries.title: Google Faces Rare Jury Trial in DOJ Bet on Public’s Tech Unease
entries.description: The Justice Department’s newest suit against Alphabet Inc.’s Google includes a surprising request: a jury trial.

entries.title: UK Sits Out Dispute Between US and EU on Green Energy Subsidies
entries.description: Britain has no plans to respond to US and European Union subsidies for green industries because the country “has nothing to subsidize,” a leading environmental economist said.

entries.title: Germany to Introduce Cheap Nationwide Public Transport From May
entries.description: Germany will introduce a cheap nationwide monthly ticket from May 1 to incentivize stronger use of public transport and lower costs for citizens.

entries.title: NYC Reports 16% Drop in Subway Crime Since October
entries.description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul said subway crime in New York City is declining as more police officers patrol the stations and cameras are installed on train cars, a positive for overall ridership.

entries.title: TikTok Ban to Get House Panel Vote Next Month, McCaul Says
entries.description: Representative Michael McCaul said he plans to have the House Foreign Affairs Committee vote next month don a new bill to ban TikTok in the US.

entries.title: Intel Could Face Fresh EU Fine in Years-Old Antitrust Case
entries.description: Intel Corp. is still in the crosshairs of European Union antitrust regulators even after the bloc’s second-highest court toppled a €1.06 billion ($1.2 billion) fine against the chip giant.

entries.title: US Charges Three in Iranian Murder-for-Hire Targeting Journalist
entries.description: The US has arrested three individuals over an Iranian plot to assassinate an Iranian-American journalist living in Brooklyn, New York, Attorney General Merrick Garland said.

entries.title: Italy Starts Talks with Lufthansa to Sell Minority Stake of ITA
entries.description: Italy initiated talks with Deutsche Lufthansa AG to sell a minority stake of ITA Airways, the successor of Alitalia SpA, in a move that may kick off aviation industry consolidation in Europe.

entries.title: Pricey SUVs Emerge as Hot Point in Debate Over EV Tax Credits
entries.description: General Motors Co. has taken a central role in pushing the Treasury Department to change how the government defines a sport utility vehicle and expand how many buyers can get electric-vehicle tax credits under President Biden’s Inflation Reduction Act.

entries.title: FDA Plans to Loosen Blood Donation Rules for Gay and Bisexual Men
entries.description: US regulators intend to make more gay and bisexual men eligible to donate blood, a move that would reverse decades-old restrictions that other countries have already removed.

entries.title: Johannesburg Picks Mayor From Party With 1% of Seats
entries.description: A member of a political party with just 1% of the seats in Johannesburg’s council was elected mayor with the support of politicians from the African National Congress, who sought to regain influence in South Africa’s richest city.

entries.title: Trump Bid to Help Ex-Aide Navarro Spurned by Judge in Contempt Case
entries.description: A letter from former President Donald Trump’s lawyer failed to persuade a judge to reconsider his refusal to dismiss a criminal contempt case against one-time White House trade adviser Peter Navarro.

entries.title: AMLO Says Plan Coming for Pemex’s Debt, Including Possible Transfer
entries.description: Mexico is developing a plan to help Petroleos Mexicanos pay off its debt, with options that could include taking on the state oil company’s debt at the sovereign level or reducing its taxes, according to President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador.

entries.title: California’s Crowded Senate Primary Race Is Set to Be Most Expensive in History
entries.description: The race to snag a once-in-generation Senate seat from California is on track to be the most expensive congressional primary ever, pitting two of the House’s most prolific fundraisers against each other to represent the country’s wealthiest and most populous state.

entries.title: Biden’s Longtime Chief of Staff Ron Klain Is Stepping Down
entries.description: President Joe Biden’s longtime chief of staff, Ron Klain, announced Friday that he would step down from his post around the time of the Feb. 7 State of the Union address next month.

entries.title: IMF Presses Ghana to Stop Borrowing From Its Central Bank
entries.description: The International Monetary Fund is pushing Ghana’s cash-strapped government to stop borrowing from its central bank, according to people familiar with the matter.

entries.title: Finland Likely to Return Giant Pandas to China After Outcry Over Upkeep
entries.description: Finland is considering sending back two giant pandas on loan from China after a public outrage over their expenses.

entries.title: EU to Battle on Oil Price Caps, Sanctions in Push to Hurt Russia
entries.description: The European Union is heading for intense talks in the coming days over how to further curb Russian revenues from exports of oil and petroleum products, and strengthen sanctions to hit President Vladimir Putin’s war machine.

entries.title: UK Sees No Need For Subsidies in US, EU Green Technology Battle
entries.description: The UK sees no need for immediate subsidies to counter US and EU proposals to boost green industries, two cabinet ministers said.

entries.title: Germany’s Lindner Won’t Face Criminal Probe on Real Estate Loans
entries.description: Christian Lindner, Germany's finance minister, during a Bloomberg Television interview in Berlin, Germany, on Wednesday, Dec. 21, 2022. Lindner said he's concerned that the US climate package known as the Inflation Reduction Act puts European companies at a disadvantage and called for "trade diplomacy" to find a solution.

entries.title: Greek Prime Minister Survives Censure Motion Over Spy Scandal
entries.description: Greece’s Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis survived a censure motion called by the main opposition leader and former premier, Alexis Tsipras over a spy scandal that broke in August.

entries.title: Biden Faces GOP Debt Showdown With Bitter Memory of 2011 Crisis
entries.description: Joe Biden was there in 2011 when Democrats tried to negotiate the type of broad deficit-reduction plan that GOP lawmakers are once again demanding as a condition of raising the federal debt ceiling.

entries.title: India Seeks Changes in Decades-Old Water Treaty With Pakistan
entries.description: India wants to change a 1960 World Bank-negotiated Indus river water-sharing agreement with Pakistan and has issued a notice to its South Asian neighbor, people with knowledge of the matter said.

entries.title: Israel, Palestinian Tensions High Ahead of Key Blinken Visit
entries.description: Tensions between Israel and Palestinian authorities intensified following a deadly clash on the West Bank, with the deteriorating situation threatening to overshadow US Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s trip next week.

entries.title: US Chip Curbs Have Echoes of Made in China
entries.description: Back in 2015, China announced a program seeking to dominate in several future-oriented areas of industry, from aerospace and electric vehicles to biotechnology.

entries.title: Yellen Positive on Cap Talks After EU Floats Russia Diesel Price
entries.description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said she’s confident that discussions aimed at extending restrictions on the sale of Russian petroleum products will be concluded within an approaching deadline that coincides with new European Union sanctions against Moscow.

entries.title: EU Weighs Prosecution Office to Help Probe Russian War Crimes
entries.description: The European Union is exploring ways to create a special prosecution office to help probe Russian war crimes in Ukraine while separate talks on a special international tribunal to punish crimes of aggression continue to be mired in legal wrangling.

entries.title: More Serbians Support EU-Required Reforms Than Joining Bloc
entries.description: Support among Serbs for joining the European Union has waned, though a majority back the economic and social reforms needed to qualify for potential membership in the 27-nation bloc, a state-organized survey shows.

entries.title: Biden’s Documents Drama Might Not Be Ending Anytime Soon
entries.description: President Joe Biden’s expectations for a quick resolution of a probe into his mishandling of classified documents have been dashed, as a steady drip of new developments has tied it into political knots.

entries.title: UK’s Hunt Says HS2 Rail Line Will End in Central London
entries.description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt said the government’s flagship high-speed rail line will extend into central London, dismissing a report that it would end in the suburbs to cut costs.

entries.title: Ukraine to Get Tanks, US Debt Row Begins: The Political Week in Photos
entries.description: In a change of policy, Ukraine’s allies finally gave the go-ahead to provide US M1 Abrams and German Leopard 2 A6 battle tanks to help fight off Russia’s invasion. The decision shows how, nearly a year into the war, keeping NATO unified   remains paramount among the alliance’s leaders.

entries.title: Thai Ruling Party Picks Prawit as Prime Minister Candidate
entries.description: The main party in Thailand’s ruling coalition named Deputy Prime Minister Prawit Wongsuwan as its sole premier candidate in general elections slated for May.

entries.title: Djokovic’s Father to Skip Australian Open Semi-Final Over Russia Flag Fallout
entries.description: The father of Serbian tennis star Novak Djokovic will not attend his son’s semi-final game at the Australian Open after he was filmed with a group of pro-Russia fans following an earlier match.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Putin’s Next Move; EU Plans Belarus Sanctions
entries.description: With Russia’s invasion into its 11th month, the International Monetary Fund is exploring a loan of as much as $16 billion to support Ukraine’s economy. It comes a week before an EU-Ukraine summit, and as Vladimir Putin’s forces prepare for a new, lengthy offensive.

entries.title: Azerbaijan Says One Dead in Unprecedented Tehran Embassy Attack
entries.description: Azerbaijan’s Foreign Ministry said several security personnel were killed and wounded after its embassy in the Iranian capital came under an unprecedented attack.

entries.title: Putin Plans New Ukraine Push Despite Losses as He Prepares for Years of War
entries.description: Russia is preparing a new offensive to regain the initiative even as it prepares for a long standoff in Ukraine

entries.title: Ex-NATO General Vies With Billionaire Babis for Czech Presidency
entries.description: A retired NATO general will seek to fend off an attempted political comeback by the Czech Republic’s billionaire former premier as the nation votes in a presidential runoff election.

entries.title: FIFA’s $2 Billion Loan Deals to Swiss Capital Gets Pushback
entries.description: Officials in Switzerland are pushing back against borrowing from FIFA after the football governing body’s loans, totaling 1.8 billion Swiss francs ($2 billion) to the capital Bern, drew criticism.

entries.title: How Young Voters Can Shake Up Nigeria’s Next Election
entries.description: Nigerians are gearing up to choose a successor to President Muhammadu Buhari, whose eight years in power have been blighted by economic decay, soaring unemployment, heightened insecurity and an exodus of the educated elite. The Feb. 25 vote in Africa’s most populous nation pits long-familiar politicians in their 70s against a challenger from a fringe opposition party who held a hefty lead in early polls. The election has sparked unprecedented interest among young Nigerians tired of being ruled b

entries.title: China Says Five Victims in California Shootings Were Citizens
entries.description: Five people killed in shootings at two farms in Northern California this week were Chinese citizens, according to the Chinese consulate in San Francisco.

entries.title: Matt Hancock Paid £320,000 for Month on ‘I’m a Celebrity’ Reality TV Show
entries.description: Matt Hancock was paid £320,000 for his controversial appearance on I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!, it has been revealed.

entries.title: Japan, Netherlands to Join US in Chip Controls on China
entries.description: Japan and the Netherlands are poised to join the US in limiting China’s access to advanced semiconductor machinery, forging a powerful alliance that will undercut Beijing’s ambitions to build its own domestic chip capabilities, according to people familiar with the negotiations.

entries.title: International Criminal Court Reopens Probe on Duterte’s Drug War
entries.description: The International Criminal Court is set to resume its investigation on the deadly drug war in the Philippines during Rodrigo Duterte’s presidency, potentially creating a dilemma for incumbent Ferdinand Marcos Jr.

entries.title: Antitrust Enforcers Need ‘Bias’ Toward Action US Official Says
entries.description: Antitrust enforcers should be willing to challenge mergers that decrease competition, without trusting corporations to stick to promised remedies, a top Justice Department official said Thursday, two days after the department sued Alphabet Inc.’s Google to break up its online advertising business.

entries.title: China Sure to Hit Back Over Chip Controls, Japan Lawmaker Says
entries.description: China is “100% sure” to retaliate over Japanese backing for Biden administration restrictions on semiconductor exports, and firms facing the fallout should look for markets elsewhere, a ruling Liberal Democratic Party lawmaker said.

entries.title: Japan to Put Indoor Masking Choice to Each Individual, NHK Says
entries.description: The Japanese government plans to leave the decision of whether to wear masks indoors up to the individual as it finalizes plans to lower the disease classification of Covid-19 in May, public broadcaster NHK reported.

entries.title: Trump Fails to Persuade Judge to Throw Out Jan 6. Civil Suit
entries.description: Former president Donald Trump failed to persuade a judge to throw out a civil lawsuit brought by Capitol Police officers over injuries they suffered during the Jan. 6 Capitol riot.

entries.title: Hunt to Rule Out Tax Cuts While Touting UK’s Brexit Potential
entries.description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt is expected to disappoint investors and his critics in the UK ruling party Friday by rejecting calls for tax cuts, even as he argues that Brexit will drive economic growth.
